critique: The executive order seems to be a technical document related to employment in the Canal Zone during a national emergency. It suspends certain provisions of previous acts due to a housing shortage. The intended audience is likely government officials or those affected by the employment regulations. The order does not seem to evoke strong emotions. However, there might be a slight sense of surprise due to the suspension of certain employment requirements. There might also be a tinge of sadness because of the housing shortage.
